thread.title: Tony Shepherd tipped to join Lend Lease Board
thread.title_full: Tony Shepherd tipped to join Lend Lease Board | afr.com

author: Joe Aston
title: Tony Shepherd tipped to join Lend Lease Board
text:
Outgoing WestConnex chairman Tony Shepherd fronts a Senate committee as chair of the federal Government's Commission of Audit Alex Ellinghausen Share on twitter Share on Google Plus by Joe Aston For someone who's supposedly retired, Tony Shepherd , 71, is a busy fellow. Sure, he left behind Transfield and the BCA presidency, but then tucked into the incoming Abbott Government's Commission of Audit (chairman, Barry O'Farrell 's Westconnex Delivery Authority (chairman) and kicked on with the AFL's frontier club GWS Giants (president).
No surprise then, that Shep has decided to give away the gig fronting the Westconnex mega-road , a project he's tirelessly proselytised for in the wake of some pretty vocal opposition .
But we're not sure he's done so simply to lighten the workload. Perhaps it's more a case of political fatigue? Because it's a fairly safe bet that – once enough time has passed and potential conflicts of interest have expired, of course (Lend Lease has been and remains a bidder for stages of the Westconnex roll-out) – we'll see Shepherd join the Board of construction giant Lend Lease .
Word is, Lend Lease chairman David Crawford (also 71, chairman of BHP spin-off South32 and a director of the Big Australian for two decades) is keen for Shep's big-project experience around his table. And who could blame him?
Stills from the WestConnex imagery showing the WestConnex freeway's St Peters interchange. St-Peters-interchange_cropped.jpg david.porter@fairfaxmedia.com.au
